title: Toledo arena holds circus, price ceiling effect

content.description:
The Toledo arena holds a maximum of 40,000 people, as indicated in the graph above. Each year the circus holds eight performances, all of which are sold out.

Analyze the effect on each of the following of the addition of a fantastic new death-defying trapeze act that increases the demand for tickets.

The price of tickets

The quantity of tickets sold

The city of Toledo institutes an effective price ceiling on tickets. Explain where the price ceiling would be set. Explain the impact of the ceiling on each of each of the following.

The quantity of tickets demanded

The quantity of tickets supplied

Will everyone who attends the circus pay the ceiling price set by the city of Toledo? Why or why not?
content.question: Respond to all parts of the question.

frqParts.text: Respond to all parts of the question.

topic.text: 2.7: Market Disequilibrium and Changes in Equilibrium

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Determine the outcome of an economic situation using economic concepts, principles, or models.
